sect1.title: Why Benchmark?
sect1.para: Usually after a new hadoop cluster is setup, benchmarking is a good way to 'kick the tires' of the cluster. Running a benchmark gives an idea that the cluster is up and running properly.
When tweaking and optimizing a hadoop cluster, benchmarks provide a baseline and provide feedback on improvments.
It is plain fun! Playing with a hadoop cluster, tweaking it and running benchmarks is pretty good fun!
Benchmarks are readily available. A good variety of benchmarks are freely available -- bundled with hadoop or open source projects. So we do not need to write a lot of code to run benchmarks

itemizedlist.listitem: TestDFSIO : This is sort of 'hello world' of hadoop benchmarks. It is bundled with hadoop and is very easy to run. This tests the IO capacity of HDFS
TerraSort : very widely used benchmark. Stresses both HDFS and MapReduce components
